content.text: Welcome to Florida Basic Driver Improvement

This course is designed to help you improve your driving skills and knowledge of traffic safety laws in Florida. You'll learn about defensive driving techniques, traffic laws, and emergency procedures.
This course must be completed with a passing score of 80% or higher to receive your certificate.

items: Understand Florida traffic laws and regulations
Learn defensive driving techniques
Recognize and respond to emergency situations
Improve overall driving safety awareness

content.text: Safe driving begins with understanding the fundamental principles of traffic safety. These principles apply to all driving situations and help prevent accidents.

items: Always maintain a safe following distance
Scan the road ahead for potential hazards
Obey all traffic signals and signs
Never drive under the influence of drugs or alcohol
Keep your vehicle in good working condition

content.text: Florida has specific traffic laws designed to keep all road users safe. Understanding these laws is essential for safe driving.
Speed limits vary by road type and location. Always observe posted speed limits and adjust for weather and traffic conditions.
Remember: Speed limits are maximum speeds under ideal conditions. You must drive slower when conditions require it.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit on Florida highways unless otherwise posted?
When approaching a school bus with flashing red lights, you must:
options: Slow down and proceed with caution
Stop and wait until the lights stop flashing
Honk your horn to alert the driver

questions.question: In Florida, you must yield the right-of-way to:
options: Emergency vehicles with lights and sirens

content.text: Defensive driving is a set of driving skills that allows you to defend yourself against possible collisions caused by bad drivers, drunk drivers, and poor weather.

items: Maintain a safe following distance (3-second rule)
Scan the road ahead and check mirrors frequently
Anticipate potential hazards and plan escape routes
Avoid distractions and stay focused on driving
Adjust speed for weather and road conditions

content.text: Being able to identify potential hazards before they become dangerous is a key skill in defensive driving.

items: Pedestrians crossing the road
Vehicles entering from side streets
Animals on or near the roadway
Construction zones and road work
Weather-related hazards (rain, fog, ice)

content.text: Knowing how to respond in emergency situations can save lives. This lesson covers the proper procedures for various emergency scenarios.

items: Stay calm and assess the situation
Move to a safe location if possible
Call emergency services if needed
Provide first aid if trained to do so
Exchange information with other parties involved

questions.question: What is the minimum safe following distance in good weather?
When should you use your hazard lights?
options: When your vehicle is disabled on the roadway

questions.question: What should you do if your brakes fail?
options: Panic and slam on the emergency brake
Downshift and use the emergency brake gradually

questions.question: In Florida, you must stop for a school bus with flashing red lights:
options: On all roads, regardless of the number of lanes

questions.question: What is the best way to avoid a collision when another driver cuts you off?
options: Honk your horn and flash your lights
Speed up to get ahead of them
Slow down and let them pass
Follow them closely to show your displeasure
